qas.question: In 1888 what country were child convicts sent to the most?
What restricted the 1870s Child labour in Australia?
Was child labour rampagnt in Australia?

answers.text: Child labour was not as excessive in Australia

qas.question: When did industrailization take off in Australia?

context: From European settlement in 1888, child convicts were occasionally sent to <a0_0>Australia<a0_0/> where they were made to work. <a2_0>Child labour was not as excessive in Australia<a2_0/> as in Britain. With a low population, agricultural productivity was higher and families did not face starvation as in established industrialised countries. Australia also did not have significant industry until the later part of the <a3_0>20th century<a3_0/> when child labour laws, and compulsory schooling had developed under the influence of Britain. From the 1870s Child labour was restricted by <a1_0>compulsorry schooling<a1_0/>.
